fields.description: HADOOP-14773 changes the ACL for yarn.resourcemanager.zk-state-store.parent-path. Earlier to HADOOP-14773, /rmstore used set acls with yarn.resourcemanager.zk-acl value. But now  behavior changed from setting acls to parent node. As a result, parent node /rmstore is set to default acl.
fields.summary: RM zk-state-store.parent-path ACLs has been changed since HADOOP-14773

comments.body:
Below is the difference  
*Before* :
{code}
[zk: localhost:2181(CONNECTED) 0] getAcl /rmstore
'sasl,'rm
: cdrwa
{code}

*After*:
{code}
[zk: localhost:2181(CONNECTED) 1] getAcl /rmstore
'world,'anyone
: cdrwa
[zk: localhost:2181(CONNECTED) 2] getAcl /rmstore/ZKRMStateRoot
'sasl,'rm
: rwa
'digest,'ctr-e138-1518143905142-346048-01-000008.test.site:C1u8x7GQW9SdBpprg1Gov7bAAf8=
: cd
{code}


The reason is while creating parent node recursively, ACLs are not set. Once parent node is created, then for further node creation acls are set. 
cc:/ [~subru] [~elgoiri]

Thanks [~rohithsharma] for reporting.
I'm trying to check in the [patch|https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12881994/HADOOP-14773-001.patch] what was the part I missed.
I believe the issue must come from HADOOP-14741 where we moved from RM_ZK_ACL to ZK_ACL.

Thanks [~rohithsharma], you are completely right.
I posted [^YARN-8405.000.patch] with the fix itself.
This needs some unit test too; let me see what we can do here.

It looks like {{TestZKRMStateStore#testZKRootPathAcls()}} should have caught this.
However, as the unit test just uses default ACLs, I don't think it is testing much.
This was added in YARN-4127 but I think it tests the setter and not the constructor side.
